enb_long_title: Twenty-sixth sessions of the Subsidiary Bodies (SB 26) of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
sentences: In the budget contact group, the Secretariat presented three budget scenarios for parties to consider: a reduction scenario adjusted for real growth using a projected inflation rate of 1.65%; a reduction scenario of US$1 million; and a reduction scenario of US$1.755 million.

The Secretariat explained that all three proposals entailed reducing the UNFCCC's contribution to the IPCC by 100%, but clarified that this would not have an impact on the UNFCCC Secretariat's work programme.
SOUTH AFRICA made reference to the degree of uncertainty with regard to forward budgeting, since the parties had not agreed on future tasks and activities of the Secretariat.
Chair Dovland pointed out that parties also had the option of accepting the original budget proposal, which proposed a 3.3% increase.
A draft decision was circulated for consideration.
Delegates reconvened for informal consultations in the afternoon, with parties exchanging further views on budget levels and various budget lines.
While developing countries generally favored the Secretariat's original budget proposal, some developed countries proposed a lower overall budget, and suggested various possible areas for savings.
Discussions will continue in a contact group on Friday.
